intro: Lasianthera africana, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
